HDG.LOG.content: omologein as when fateful comes to pass, proper hearing [when does fateful not come to pass? Nietzsche, Derrida], the laying that gathering has sent (die lesende Lege geschickt hat): where, and as what, does the fateful presence?
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: omologein as when fateful comes to pass, proper hearing [when does fateful not come to pass? Nietzsche, Derrida], the laying that gathering has sent (die lesende Lege geschickt hat): where, and as what, does the fateful presence?

HDG.ID.content: Hegel: “the real is the rational, and the rational is the real”
HDG.ID.linkedContent: Hegel: “the real is the rational, and the rational is the real”

HDG.IM.content: Nietzsche: highest concepts, Being, final wisp of evaporating reality [Twilight of the Idols]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: Nietzsche: highest concepts, Being, final wisp of evaporating reality [Twilight of the Idols]

HDG.IM.content: [method contra Nietzsche] unfolding that which was realized through Nietzsche by truly engaged attack on him > is Nietzsche final victim of fall out of Being? witness to a new necessity?
HDG.IM.linkedContent: [method contra Nietzsche] unfolding that which was realized through Nietzsche by truly engaged attack on him > is Nietzsche final victim of fall out of Being? witness to a new necessity?

HDG.IM.content: “we lie in the pincers” > people must transpose itself from center of future happening into originary realm of powers of Being [but you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet!!!] > to ask how does it stand w/ Being? to repeat and retrieve (wieder-holen) inception of our historical-spiritual Dasein (inception begun again more originally) [repetition of origin]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: “we lie in the pincers” > people must transpose itself from center of future happening into originary realm of powers of Being [but you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet!!!] > to ask how does it stand w/ Being? to repeat and retrieve (wieder-holen) inception of our historical-spiritual Dasein (inception begun again more originally) [repetition of origin]

HDG.IM.content: Nietzsche dismissive, “Being” is a deception that shouldn’t have happened [that’s a rather dismissive view of Nietzsche’s subtlety] > [regardless of answer to Nietzsche, Heidegger will not relinquish strategy of “aura” of question] [moral image of thought]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: Nietzsche dismissive, “Being” is a deception that shouldn’t have happened [that’s a rather dismissive view of Nietzsche’s subtlety] > [regardless of answer to Nietzsche, Heidegger will not relinquish strategy of “aura” of question] [moral image of thought]

HDG.IM.content: [doesn’t respond to Nietzsche, just props hermeneutics of historicity btwn question & its answer]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: [doesn’t respond to Nietzsche, just props hermeneutics of historicity btwn question & its answer]

HDG.IM.content: we stand w/in a language that made Being a mere word, if we call it a fact, this is a provisional formulation [Vorläufigkeit] > still have not thought through, still coming to grips w/ this “fact” [so Nietzsche didn’t think it through?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: we stand w/in a language that made Being a mere word, if we call it a fact, this is a provisional formulation [Vorläufigkeit] > still have not thought through, still coming to grips w/ this “fact” [so Nietzsche didn’t think it through?]

HDG.IM.content: emptiness of word “Being,” complete withering of its naming force, not just particular case of general abuse of language: the destroyed relation to Being as such [the name?] is real ground for whole misrelation to language [how do you know this if you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet?] [if it is exemplary, what does the particular name matter?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: emptiness of word “Being,” complete withering of its naming force, not just particular case of general abuse of language: the destroyed relation to Being as such [the name?] is real ground for whole misrelation to language [how do you know this if you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet?] [if it is exemplary, what does the particular name matter?]

HDG.BC.content: modern position is the “technological,” epoch is technological, already decided mode of world-interpretation: interprets possibilities for any human attitude, preforms them acc. their capacity for implementation > practical mastery of technology presupposes metaphysical subjugation to technology, grasp everything acc. plan/calculation, to secure what can last for longest possible duration > Nietzsche clearly envisioned that this will [of technology] would attain unconditional shape in 20th century, unconditional mastery of earth
HDG.BC.linkedContent: modern position is the “technological,” epoch is technological, already decided mode of world-interpretation: interprets possibilities for any human attitude, preforms them acc. their capacity for implementation > practical mastery of technology presupposes metaphysical subjugation to technology, grasp everything acc. plan/calculation, to secure what can last for longest possible duration > Nietzsche clearly envisioned that this will [of technology] would attain unconditional shape in 20th century, unconditional mastery of earth

HDG.BC.content: subjugation to technology doesn’t appear as resistance/resentment [hide behind love? Nietzsche]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: subjugation to technology doesn’t appear as resistance/resentment [hide behind love? Nietzsche]

HDG.BC.content: Nietzsche’s “being” as “last breath of a vaporizing reality”: what happens to ontological difference in this disappearance [can’t Nietzsche affirm a more ancient difference, i.e. differance?]?
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s “being” as “last breath of a vaporizing reality”: what happens to ontological difference in this disappearance [can’t Nietzsche affirm a more ancient difference, i.e. differance?]?

HDG.BC.content: via Nietzsche, soldier and worker determine the actual [MOP], unique fusion: “type of humanity taken as measure by the present world-convulsion (Welterschütterung) [epoch] for its fulfillment (Vollzug),” metaphysical titles that name form of human fulfillment of being of beings now manifest, presciently called “will to power” [but it is not epochal for Nietzsche] [Heidegger on the sly]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: via Nietzsche, soldier and worker determine the actual [MOP], unique fusion: “type of humanity taken as measure by the present world-convulsion (Welterschütterung) [epoch] for its fulfillment (Vollzug),” metaphysical titles that name form of human fulfillment of being of beings now manifest, presciently called “will to power” [but it is not epochal for Nietzsche] [Heidegger on the sly]

HDG.BC.content: [Nietzsche’s nearly Marxist take on a future where each human achieves the highest that lies w/in his realm] > “worker,” “soldier,” “socialist,” for Nietzsche, leading representatives enacting “will to power”
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [Nietzsche’s nearly Marxist take on a future where each human achieves the highest that lies w/in his realm] > “worker,” “soldier,” “socialist,” for Nietzsche, leading representatives enacting “will to power”

HDG.BC.content: clock stops, we become aware of “is,” an interruption intrudes on speaking [attention beyond time?] > can only experience interruption hypothetically [yes! Derrida, Nietzsche, bell tolls]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: clock stops, we become aware of “is,” an interruption intrudes on speaking [attention beyond time?] > can only experience interruption hypothetically [yes! Derrida, Nietzsche, bell tolls]

HDG.BC.content: for Plato, being most authentic being; for Nietzsche, being as most negative [no!] > Plato/Nietzsche part of same interpretation (doctrine of Western metaphysics): being is the most universal of the universal (koinotaton)
HDG.BC.linkedContent: for Plato, being most authentic being; for Nietzsche, being as most negative [no!] > Plato/Nietzsche part of same interpretation (doctrine of Western metaphysics): being is the most universal of the universal (koinotaton)

HDG.BC.content: [re: clinging to beings, equating dealing w/ the actual] acting (Handeln)/effecting (Wirken) bring to experience what the actual (Wirkliche) is [?], accompanied by freedom, participation in law of age > acc. Heidegger, Nietzsche’s freedom [“for what is freedom? that one has the will to self-responsibility”] conceives being a self as will to power, freedom as will to fulfill “will to power” (Nietzsche thinks like/unlike Kant): participation in actuality of actual
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [re: clinging to beings, equating dealing w/ the actual] acting (Handeln)/effecting (Wirken) bring to experience what the actual (Wirkliche) is [?], accompanied by freedom, participation in law of age > acc. Heidegger, Nietzsche’s freedom [“for what is freedom? that one has the will to self-responsibility”] conceives being a self as will to power, freedom as will to fulfill “will to power” (Nietzsche thinks like/unlike Kant): participation in actuality of actual

HDG.BC.content: [indifference point not dialectical sublation] Hegel could never say “Actuality” and nothing are the same, though he does realize both are most extreme abstractions of “actuality” > attend to the following only in passing [?]: Nothing presences, not the nullity people apply to it > when Nothing rests on fancy, mere play of understanding, the emptiest & the unique [just like Being] > Nothing not a nullity (for us): horror towards devastation, recoiling in terror of annihilation: shrinking back from something that can’t be addressed as mere imagination or something baseless
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [indifference point not dialectical sublation] Hegel could never say “Actuality” and nothing are the same, though he does realize both are most extreme abstractions of “actuality” > attend to the following only in passing [?]: Nothing presences, not the nullity people apply to it > when Nothing rests on fancy, mere play of understanding, the emptiest & the unique [just like Being] > Nothing not a nullity (for us): horror towards devastation, recoiling in terror of annihilation: shrinking back from something that can’t be addressed as mere imagination or something baseless

HDG.WM.content: nothing awakens for 1st time proper formulation of metaphysical question re: Being of beings > nothing not as indeterminate opposite of beings, unveils itself as belonging to Being of beings > agrees w/ Hegel’s “Pure Being and pure Nothing are therefore the same” [also quoted in HDG.BC]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: nothing awakens for 1st time proper formulation of metaphysical question re: Being of beings > nothing not as indeterminate opposite of beings, unveils itself as belonging to Being of beings > agrees w/ Hegel’s “Pure Being and pure Nothing are therefore the same” [also quoted in HDG.BC]

HDG.QB.content: to connect “work” & “pain”: think fundamental trait of Hegel’s metaphysics: “absolute negativity” as “infinite force” of actuality, i.e., of the “existing concept” > work & pain manifest their innermost metaphysical relatedness in same (not identical) belonging to negation of negation
HDG.QB.linkedContent: to connect “work” & “pain”: think fundamental trait of Hegel’s metaphysics: “absolute negativity” as “infinite force” of actuality, i.e., of the “existing concept” > work & pain manifest their innermost metaphysical relatedness in same (not identical) belonging to negation of negation

HDG.QB.content: algos (pain) related to alegō, the intensivum of legō, means intimate gathering: pain as that which gathers most intimately: Hegel’s concept of “concept,” “strenuous effort” it entails
HDG.QB.linkedContent: algos (pain) related to alegō, the intensivum of legō, means intimate gathering: pain as that which gathers most intimately: Hegel’s concept of “concept,” “strenuous effort” it entails

HDG.QB.content: for Jünger, reduction characteristic of nihilistic trends; for Heidegger, reduction w/in Beings rests in a production of Being: unfolding of will to power into unconditional will to will [using destiny to affirm fuzzy assessments of an epoch] > the disappearance (Schwund) (absence) determined out of/through a presence (Praesenz), such presence precedes/surpasses all that disappears [nihilism & metaphysics as same destiny, Nietzsche]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: for Jünger, reduction characteristic of nihilistic trends; for Heidegger, reduction w/in Beings rests in a production of Being: unfolding of will to power into unconditional will to will [using destiny to affirm fuzzy assessments of an epoch] > the disappearance (Schwund) (absence) determined out of/through a presence (Praesenz), such presence precedes/surpasses all that disappears [nihilism & metaphysics as same destiny, Nietzsche]

HDG.QB.content: Nietzsche (every contemporary thinks/poetizes “for”/“against” him) heard a calling demanding humans to prepare for dominating the earth, not war but polemos that first lets gods, humans, freemen, slaves appear in their essence, leads to a critical encounter of X Being [compared to this encounter, world wars remain superficial (vordergründig)] > did he collapse (stürzte) or take his thinking as far as he was able to go? > this thinking no easier for us: must restrict itself to something precursory (Vorläufigeres): give careful thought to ancient/venerable words whose saying addresses (zuspricht) us to essential realm of nihilism & its recovery (Verwindung) [paleonym]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: Nietzsche (every contemporary thinks/poetizes “for”/“against” him) heard a calling demanding humans to prepare for dominating the earth, not war but polemos that first lets gods, humans, freemen, slaves appear in their essence, leads to a critical encounter of X Being [compared to this encounter, world wars remain superficial (vordergründig)] > did he collapse (stürzte) or take his thinking as far as he was able to go? > this thinking no easier for us: must restrict itself to something precursory (Vorläufigeres): give careful thought to ancient/venerable words whose saying addresses (zuspricht) us to essential realm of nihilism & its recovery (Verwindung) [paleonym]

HDG.FS.content: matter (Sache) itself is sole authority, in seminar we work in common, text is only a means (Mittel), not an end (Ziel) [cf. Derrida] > in genuine seminar, teacher learns the most, he must listen rightly (rechte Hören) to the text > nothing ever to be believed, must be experienced [secret (Geheimnis) of seminar, be able to read Hegel’s whole book]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: matter (Sache) itself is sole authority, in seminar we work in common, text is only a means (Mittel), not an end (Ziel) [cf. Derrida] > in genuine seminar, teacher learns the most, he must listen rightly (rechte Hören) to the text > nothing ever to be believed, must be experienced [secret (Geheimnis) of seminar, be able to read Hegel’s whole book]

HDG.FS.content: Hegel: “a torn sock is better then a mended one…” > to understand (Verstehen), must see (sehen) phenomenologically, invitation to phenomenological “kindergarten”: to tear apart (Zer-reissen), to tear in 2 parts, to separate, make 2 out of 1: torn sock no longer present-at-hand [sock appears outside its usage, w/ more force (Kraft)] > diese Einheit [the unity of the whole sock] ist im Zerrissensein [being-torn] als verlorene [lost] Einheit gegenwärtig
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel: “a torn sock is better then a mended one…” > to understand (Verstehen), must see (sehen) phenomenologically, invitation to phenomenological “kindergarten”: to tear apart (Zer-reissen), to tear in 2 parts, to separate, make 2 out of 1: torn sock no longer present-at-hand [sock appears outside its usage, w/ more force (Kraft)] > diese Einheit [the unity of the whole sock] ist im Zerrissensein [being-torn] als verlorene [lost] Einheit gegenwärtig

HDG.FS.content: reading Hegel’s “dichotomy (Entzweiung) is the source of the need for philosophy” [Differenz…], Heidegger states that all attempts to suppress “tearing” must be abandoned, “tearing” im Grunde remains and must remain: “in the tearing…there always reigns (waltet) unity or a necessary conjoining (Vereinigung) that is, a living unity”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: reading Hegel’s “dichotomy (Entzweiung) is the source of the need for philosophy” [Differenz…], Heidegger states that all attempts to suppress “tearing” must be abandoned, “tearing” im Grunde remains and must remain: “in the tearing…there always reigns (waltet) unity or a necessary conjoining (Vereinigung) that is, a living unity”

HDG.FS.content: acc. Heidegger, for Hegel, bad infinite = endless character of finite, ad infinitum; true infinite, in-finite, sublation of finite, where finite is abandoned (das Endliche verlassen wird) = power of conjoining itself
HDG.FS.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, for Hegel, bad infinite = endless character of finite, ad infinitum; true infinite, in-finite, sublation of finite, where finite is abandoned (das Endliche verlassen wird) = power of conjoining itself

HDG.FS.content: consciousness, for Hegel, the dimension of subjectivity, “seeing everything together,” co-agere
HDG.FS.linkedContent: consciousness, for Hegel, the dimension of subjectivity, “seeing everything together,” co-agere

HDG.FS.content: for Hegel, need for unity because unity never given immediately, otherwise [unity given immediately]: Schelling’s “night where all cows are black”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Hegel, need for unity because unity never given immediately, otherwise [unity given immediately]: Schelling’s “night where all cows are black”

HDG.FS.content: Hegel uses word science (Wissenschaft) in Fichte’s sense, “System of Science,” system of philosophy, “Science”: philosophy become absolute knowledge (of subject)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel uses word science (Wissenschaft) in Fichte’s sense, “System of Science,” system of philosophy, “Science”: philosophy become absolute knowledge (of subject)

HDG.FS.content: for Kant, ground of everything, only idea (opposed to intuition/concept) of speculative reason, ungrounded, abyssal > Kant witnessed with horror what began to take place w/ Fichte: Fichte & Hegel look for ground where for Kant there’s only abyss
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Kant, ground of everything, only idea (opposed to intuition/concept) of speculative reason, ungrounded, abyssal > Kant witnessed with horror what began to take place w/ Fichte: Fichte & Hegel look for ground where for Kant there’s only abyss

HDG.FS.content: Kant emphasizes finitude/powerlessness of speculative reason > Hegel makes it instrument of philosophical activity, speculation becomes autonomous, unveils power impossible for Kant
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Kant emphasizes finitude/powerlessness of speculative reason > Hegel makes it instrument of philosophical activity, speculation becomes autonomous, unveils power impossible for Kant

HDG.FS.content: for Hegel, reflection gains standing (Bestehen) in absolute [?], this standing goes unanalyzed in Hegel (limit in his thought?) [does Heidegger analyze standing sufficiently?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Hegel, reflection gains standing (Bestehen) in absolute [?], this standing goes unanalyzed in Hegel (limit in his thought?) [does Heidegger analyze standing sufficiently?]

HDG.FS.content: [deconstructive method?] formulating question of Being in relation to Hegel can only be done on basis of Hegel’s text
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [deconstructive method?] formulating question of Being in relation to Hegel can only be done on basis of Hegel’s text

HDG.FS.content: “reflection,” Latin re-flexere, turning-back upon itself (zurückzuwenden), towards the ego > in Descartes, ego, as cogitans, appears as cogitatum, object > in Kant’s language: “it must be possible for the I think to accompany all my representations” > transcendental apperception re: finite essence of man > Hegel absolutizes finite understanding, brings power of conjoining to absolute power: “what is finite w/ man becomes the infinite Absolute” > infinite as sublation of finite
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “reflection,” Latin re-flexere, turning-back upon itself (zurückzuwenden), towards the ego > in Descartes, ego, as cogitans, appears as cogitatum, object > in Kant’s language: “it must be possible for the I think to accompany all my representations” > transcendental apperception re: finite essence of man > Hegel absolutizes finite understanding, brings power of conjoining to absolute power: “what is finite w/ man becomes the infinite Absolute” > infinite as sublation of finite

HDG.FS.content: difference btwn Descartes/Hegel: Descartes only sets foot on terra firma (feste Land) of “consciousness,” Hegel thoroughly traverses it > Hegel surveys this land, measures it, not mathematically: the measure is metaphysical/total/“absolute” [method is dialectic]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: difference btwn Descartes/Hegel: Descartes only sets foot on terra firma (feste Land) of “consciousness,” Hegel thoroughly traverses it > Hegel surveys this land, measures it, not mathematically: the measure is metaphysical/total/“absolute” [method is dialectic]

HDG.FS.content: Hegel: “Reason constructs itself in its emanation as an identity that is conditioned by this very duplicate [Reason’s appearance]” > acc. Heidegger, understand Hegel by explicating “infinite world-intuition” > intuition—individual; concept—general
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel: “Reason constructs itself in its emanation as an identity that is conditioned by this very duplicate [Reason’s appearance]” > acc. Heidegger, understand Hegel by explicating “infinite world-intuition” > intuition—individual; concept—general

HDG.FS.content: Hegel characterizes finite as fixity, to fix is to posit, posit apart, and thus in opposition > “the position individuates something posited against something else (Die Setzung vereinzelt etwas Gesetztes gegen ein Anderes” > finitude thus circumscribed by non-determination, nothingness [?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel characterizes finite as fixity, to fix is to posit, posit apart, and thus in opposition > “the position individuates something posited against something else (Die Setzung vereinzelt etwas Gesetztes gegen ein Anderes” > finitude thus circumscribed by non-determination, nothingness [?]

HDG.FS.content: for Hegel, all moments (reflection, construction, production, contraction) when grasping of Absolute by Reason are accomplished takes place in “consciousness”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Hegel, all moments (reflection, construction, production, contraction) when grasping of Absolute by Reason are accomplished takes place in “consciousness”

HDG.FS.content: [phenomenological exercise on Louvre more important that reading Hegel]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [phenomenological exercise on Louvre more important that reading Hegel]

HDG.FS.content: “positing” (or positio) has several meanings, thesis in sense of “to have standing before oneself (vor sich stehend haben)” > this helps us understand why, for Hegel, 2nd moment of absolute Reason is “Construction”: Absolute must be “constructed” for consciousness, construction is also production
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “positing” (or positio) has several meanings, thesis in sense of “to have standing before oneself (vor sich stehend haben)” > this helps us understand why, for Hegel, 2nd moment of absolute Reason is “Construction”: Absolute must be “constructed” for consciousness, construction is also production

HDG.FS.content: for Hegel, production of Absolute: Gestalt of reflection’s accomplishment (Vollzugs) > Absolute brought forth before consciousness, i.e. pro-duced, not making but “letting appear (erscheinen Lassen)” > this pro-duction is a construction (architectonic) that means: Zusammengehöriges im Sich-zeigen des Absoluten als zusammengehörig zusammenbauen (zusammenstellen) [belonging together in self-showing (of Absolute) as belonging together that builds together (a setting together)]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Hegel, production of Absolute: Gestalt of reflection’s accomplishment (Vollzugs) > Absolute brought forth before consciousness, i.e. pro-duced, not making but “letting appear (erscheinen Lassen)” > this pro-duction is a construction (architectonic) that means: Zusammengehöriges im Sich-zeigen des Absoluten als zusammengehörig zusammenbauen (zusammenstellen) [belonging together in self-showing (of Absolute) as belonging together that builds together (a setting together)]

HDG.FS.content: final moment of Absolute in Hegel, contraction, cum-trahere, drawing-together (zusammen-ziehen) of all opposites to highest unity of Absolute [condensation?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: final moment of Absolute in Hegel, contraction, cum-trahere, drawing-together (zusammen-ziehen) of all opposites to highest unity of Absolute [condensation?]

HDG.FS.content: Hegel’s “non-conscious (das Bewusstlose)” evokes Freud, but difference is extreme: Freud’s unconscious (das Unbewusste) doesn’t belong “in consciousness,” whereas for Hegel, difference btwn conscious/non-conscious belongs to consciousness, constructed in consciousness as the Absolute (which is both) > for Hegel [?], non-conscious means not yet posited/sublated
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel’s “non-conscious (das Bewusstlose)” evokes Freud, but difference is extreme: Freud’s unconscious (das Unbewusste) doesn’t belong “in consciousness,” whereas for Hegel, difference btwn conscious/non-conscious belongs to consciousness, constructed in consciousness as the Absolute (which is both) > for Hegel [?], non-conscious means not yet posited/sublated

HDG.FS.content: Hegel obstructs access (Zugang) to Greek meaning of being from ground up when he claims Greeks had yet to think subjective as mediation, i.e. as core (Kern) of objectivity > Hegel excludes himself from Greek experience of being as phenomenon
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel obstructs access (Zugang) to Greek meaning of being from ground up when he claims Greeks had yet to think subjective as mediation, i.e. as core (Kern) of objectivity > Hegel excludes himself from Greek experience of being as phenomenon

HDG.FS.content: as Descartes determines ground (Boden) by firmness (Festigkeit) (no longer let ground be as it is from itself), he surrenders the ground, abandons (verlässt) it for sake of firmness [Heidegger rethinking Hegel’s terra firma assessment about Descartes]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: as Descartes determines ground (Boden) by firmness (Festigkeit) (no longer let ground be as it is from itself), he surrenders the ground, abandons (verlässt) it for sake of firmness [Heidegger rethinking Hegel’s terra firma assessment about Descartes]

HDG.FS.content: Marx reverses Hegel’s idealism (uniquely), requires that Being be given precedence over consciousness [?] > for Marx, Being is production process, receives this representation from metaphysics via Hegel’s interpretation of life as process
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Marx reverses Hegel’s idealism (uniquely), requires that Being be given precedence over consciousness [?] > for Marx, Being is production process, receives this representation from metaphysics via Hegel’s interpretation of life as process

HDG.FS.content: for Heidegger, identity of being/nothing thought in departure (im Ausgang) from ontological difference [departure as from or as leaving behind? cf. 58 departure from Being] > [Hegel thinks this identity w/out concern for ontological difference]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Heidegger, identity of being/nothing thought in departure (im Ausgang) from ontological difference [departure as from or as leaving behind? cf. 58 departure from Being] > [Hegel thinks this identity w/out concern for ontological difference]

HDG.FS.content: Hegel’s Logic presents God’s thought before creation [?] > “creation” as production (Herstellung) of world > via Aristotle, before creation, God thinks eidos of world, totality of categories: Hegel’s ontology presents ontology from which God takes measure of his creation (Kant’s intuitus originarius)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel’s Logic presents God’s thought before creation [?] > “creation” as production (Herstellung) of world > via Aristotle, before creation, God thinks eidos of world, totality of categories: Hegel’s ontology presents ontology from which God takes measure of his creation (Kant’s intuitus originarius)

HDG.FS.content: when attention is drawn to the presencing (das Anwesen) of “letting-be,” this interpretation that of metaphysics [doesn’t Heidegger interpret as such in Anaximander?] > in emphasis (Betonung) on presencing, a 3rd has its place (Ort), the stress (Ton) now on letting itself, that which allows (lässt) (releases [entlässt]?) presencing, allows Being, the epochē of Being: one stands before being as being, not a form (Gestalten) of its destiny [so close to Hegel] > in emphasis to let presencing, no longer room for name Being, letting is pure giving, the it (das Es) that gives, Ereignis [beyond Being]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: when attention is drawn to the presencing (das Anwesen) of “letting-be,” this interpretation that of metaphysics [doesn’t Heidegger interpret as such in Anaximander?] > in emphasis (Betonung) on presencing, a 3rd has its place (Ort), the stress (Ton) now on letting itself, that which allows (lässt) (releases [entlässt]?) presencing, allows Being, the epochē of Being: one stands before being as being, not a form (Gestalten) of its destiny [so close to Hegel] > in emphasis to let presencing, no longer room for name Being, letting is pure giving, the it (das Es) that gives, Ereignis [beyond Being]

HDG.FS.content: thinking Ereignis w/ concepts of Being, history of Being, won’t be successful, nor w/ assistance of the Greek (something “to go beyond” [Nietzsche on Socrates]) > Mit dem Sein verschwindet auch die ontologische Differenz [w/ Being, ontological difference vanishes: i.e. Ereignis goes beyond both?]: ontological difference (1927-1936) a necessary impasse (Holzweg)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: thinking Ereignis w/ concepts of Being, history of Being, won’t be successful, nor w/ assistance of the Greek (something “to go beyond” [Nietzsche on Socrates]) > Mit dem Sein verschwindet auch die ontologische Differenz [w/ Being, ontological difference vanishes: i.e. Ereignis goes beyond both?]: ontological difference (1927-1936) a necessary impasse (Holzweg)

HDG.FS.content: human belongs to openness of Being > Being, for its opening, needs man as the there of its manifestation [Larry’s emphasis] > Ge-stell helps us see that human is “used by being (vom Sein gebraucht),” also the shepherd of being, berger (French is better here), one who provides shelter > that Being needs something of human to be: finitude of being must be assumed (not absolutely for itself, pointed contradiction to Hegel)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: human belongs to openness of Being > Being, for its opening, needs man as the there of its manifestation [Larry’s emphasis] > Ge-stell helps us see that human is “used by being (vom Sein gebraucht),” also the shepherd of being, berger (French is better here), one who provides shelter > that Being needs something of human to be: finitude of being must be assumed (not absolutely for itself, pointed contradiction to Hegel)

HDG.FS.content: Marxism as a whole rests on this thesis [from Early Writings]: “to be radical is to grasp the root of the matter, but for man the root is man himself,” thinks on the basis of production: social production of society, self-production of human being as social being > Marxism is thought of today, where self-production of man & society prevail [isn’t Nietzsche & Hegel also thought of today?] > self-production (Selbstherstellung) raises danger (Gefahr) of self-destruction (Selbstzerstörung)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Marxism as a whole rests on this thesis [from Early Writings]: “to be radical is to grasp the root of the matter, but for man the root is man himself,” thinks on the basis of production: social production of society, self-production of human being as social being > Marxism is thought of today, where self-production of man & society prevail [isn’t Nietzsche & Hegel also thought of today?] > self-production (Selbstherstellung) raises danger (Gefahr) of self-destruction (Selbstzerstörung)

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]

HDG.EC.content: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil
HDG.EC.linkedContent: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil

HDG.EC.content: historiological reckoning a consequence of devastation, man rolls into nothing > nihilism only historically actual when abandonment of beings by being occurs: this abandonment still lets beings be [?] > Nietzsche did not grasp essence of nihilism, remained caught (gefangen) in it, his metaphysics prepares for complete, unconditional nihilism, belongs to process of devastation
HDG.EC.linkedContent: historiological reckoning a consequence of devastation, man rolls into nothing > nihilism only historically actual when abandonment of beings by being occurs: this abandonment still lets beings be [?] > Nietzsche did not grasp essence of nihilism, remained caught (gefangen) in it, his metaphysics prepares for complete, unconditional nihilism, belongs to process of devastation

HDG.EC.content: [can’t pass judgment on ontology of world-event] devastation comes forth from being, is a world-event (Weltereignis) that beleaguers (umlagert) the earth > person who passes judgment falls prey to quarreling/annoyance that gnaw at him, he becomes slave to self-righteousness (Selbstgerechtigkeit) [Nietzsche on revenge dimming one’s own eyes]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: [can’t pass judgment on ontology of world-event] devastation comes forth from being, is a world-event (Weltereignis) that beleaguers (umlagert) the earth > person who passes judgment falls prey to quarreling/annoyance that gnaw at him, he becomes slave to self-righteousness (Selbstgerechtigkeit) [Nietzsche on revenge dimming one’s own eyes]

HDG.OHF.content: the being-context or validity-context of system either: 1) free-floating, absolutely valid in itself 2) or both what’s thought by Absolute spirit and its thinking (Hegel or Augustinian Neoplatonism)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: the being-context or validity-context of system either: 1) free-floating, absolutely valid in itself 2) or both what’s thought by Absolute spirit and its thinking (Hegel or Augustinian Neoplatonism)

HDG.OHF.content: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material

HDG.OHF.content: [Hegel as objective scientific philosophy] “Spirit” now lives in abode (Ort) of its self-certainty, no more goals, feelings, interests: “life has retired (zurückgezogen) into its authentic freedom”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Hegel as objective scientific philosophy] “Spirit” now lives in abode (Ort) of its self-certainty, no more goals, feelings, interests: “life has retired (zurückgezogen) into its authentic freedom”
